definitions.text: fastener consisting of a resinous composition that is plastic when warm; used for sealing documents and parcels and letters
a device incised to make an impression; used to secure a closing or to authenticate documents
the pelt or fur (especially the underfur) of a seal
a member of a Naval Special Warfare unit who is trained for unconventional warfare
examples: SEAL is an acronym for Sea Air and Land

definitions.text: a stamp affixed to a document (as to attest to its authenticity or to seal it)
examples: the warrant bore the sheriff's seal

definitions.text: an indication of approved or superior status
a finishing coat applied to exclude moisture
fastener that provides a tight and perfect closure
any of numerous marine mammals that come on shore to breed; chiefly of cold regions
close with or as if with a seal
examples: She sealed the letter with hot wax
